The manual http://manual.qooxdoo.org/1.2.x/pages/core/defining_properties.html in section "Defining an apply method" should provide a link to the relevant API page http://demo.qooxdoo.org/1.2/apiviewer/#qx.core.Property (e.g. after the example), as this is probably not so straigt-forward to find.
Also, the example shows an apply method with only two parameters, while there are actually three (the last one being the name of the property being applied to). I think this can be mis-leading and I would find it more sensible to list all three parameters.
It might be useful to explain that the name parameter could be used to execute different code depending on the name, if the same apply method is used for several properties. Or this could be shown in a code snippet being linked from the manual (I could provide a snippet).
Thomas, haven't you just been working on completing docs?

(In reply to comment #1) > Thomas, haven't you just been working on completing docs?
I just fixed the API doc qx.core.Property, nothing in the manual.
We can fix this if we have some time right before the release.
Maybe we should check if that documentation was missing on intension and if that parameter is always available. --> Martin
(In reply to comment #5) Please DO MAKE SURE that this parameter IS ALWAYS available! I think the apply method MUST have a way to figure out the property it applies to.
Yes it should be but as I said, I would not be surprised if it currently isn't. we need to check that to see if its reliable.
